title: Integral points on cubic surfaces: heuristics and numerics
abstract:
We develop a heuristic for the density of integer points on affine cubic
surfaces. Our heuristic applies to smooth surfaces defined by cubic polynomials
that are log K3, but it can also be adjusted to handle singular cubic surfaces.
We compare our heuristic to Heath-Brown's prediction for sums of three cubes,
as well as to asymptotic formulae in the literature around Zagier's work on the
Markoff cubic surface, and work of Baragar and Umeda on further surfaces of
Markoff-type. We also test our heuristic against numerical data for several
families of cubic surfaces.
